title.native: 名探偵コナン 紺青の拳（フィスト）
title.english: Case Closed: The Fist of Blue Sapphire

description: The world's greatest blue sapphire, the "blue lapis fist", said to have sunk in a pirate ship in the late 19th century, on the coasts of Singapore. A local millionaire plots to retrieve it, and when it's exhibited in an exhibition at the Singaporean Marina Sands hotel, a murder takes place. A bloody Kaitou Kid announcement card is found in the crime scene.
synonyms: Detective Conan Movie 23: The Fist of Blue Sapphire
Meitantei Conan Movie 23: Konjou no Fist
Detectiu Conan: El puny de safir blau
Detetive Conan: O Punho da Safira Azul
Detective Conan: El puño de Zafiro azul

tags.name: Crossover
tags.description: Centers around the placement of two or more otherwise discrete fictional characters, settings, or universes into the context of a single story.

tags.name: Detective
tags.description: Features a character who investigates and solves crimes.

tags.name: Foreign
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a country outside the country of origin.

tags.name: Police
tags.description: Centers around the life and activities of law enforcement officers.

tags.name: Crime
tags.description: Centers around unlawful activities punishable by the state or other authority.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: Age Regression
tags.description: Prominently features a character who was returned to a younger state.

tags.name: Martial Arts
tags.description: Centers around the use of traditional hand-to-hand combat.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Guns
tags.description: Prominently features the use of guns in combat.

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

tags.name: Tanned Skin
tags.description: Prominently features characters with tanned skin.

title.native: 名探偵コナン

name.native: ヘズリ・ジャマルディン
ジョン・ハン・チェン

node.description:
__Favorite Food:__ Rice with curry

Gosho Aoyama, alternatively known by his real name Yoshimasa Aoyama, is a Japanese mangaka and animator, best known as the creator of Detective Conan (internationally known as Case Closed), Magic Kaito, and YAIBA.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/1178607902522654720)

Originating from Ad Cosmo. Frequent presence in the [Gundam](https://anilist.co/anime/2581/) franchise since 2007.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/須藤昌朋)

Originating from Studio Annapuru, currently freelance.

Debuted as an in-betweener on the second season of [Ashita no Joe](https://anilist.co/anime/2921/). He is particularly known for his involvement in [TMS Entertainment's](https://anilist.co/studio/73/) works, mainly the [Detective Conan](https://anilist.co/anime/235/) franchise, in which he has served as a character designer and animation director on all of the theatrical movies.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/須藤昌朋)

Originating from Studio Annapuru, currently freelance.

Debuted as an in-betweener on the second season of [Ashita no Joe](https://anilist.co/anime/2921/). He is particularly known for his involvement in [TMS Entertainment's](https://anilist.co/studio/73/) works, mainly the [Detective Conan](https://anilist.co/anime/235/) franchise, in which he has served as a character designer and animation director on all of the theatrical movies.

__Favorite Food:__ Rice with curry

Gosho Aoyama, alternatively known by his real name Yoshimasa Aoyama, is a Japanese mangaka and animator, best known as the creator of Detective Conan (internationally known as Case Closed), Magic Kaito, and YAIBA.

[Website](https://www.kaylimillsva.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/kaylimills) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/kaylimills/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/user/MewKiyoko) | [TikTok](https://www.tiktok.com/@thedonutgremlin) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kayli_Mills)

Kayli grew up in multiple towns in the LP (mitten) of Michigan. As a child, she was frequently relocated, but in middle school, she found comfort and friendship in creating song covers, writing and voice acting online. After years of chasing her dream, you can hear her as colorful cast of characters including [Alice](https://anilist.co/character/75450) ([Sword Art Online](https://anilist.co/anime/100182)), [Emilia](https://anilist.co/character/88572) ([Re:Zero](https://anilist.co/anime/21355)), Rainbow Kate (Shopkins), [Clara](https://anilist.co/character/135019) ([Welcome to Demon School, Iruma-kun](https://anilist.co/anime/107693)) and many more!

A casual gamer, she enjoys playing a variety of games to de-stress including Animal Crossing, Pokémon, The Sims and the occasional match of Smash. You can also hear her as Riley Miller (Valkyria Chronicles 4), Quna (PSO2 - singing and speaking), Thea, Mareeta and Tsubasa (Fire Emblem Heroes), Spinaria and a handful of cards (Shadowverse) and many more!

Beyond being a voice actor, Kayli is also a professional writer, lyricist, and singer with a certification in audio engineering and a YouTube channel with a following for her cover songs. She adapted, recorded guides for, and helped direct the opening of the [Cells at Work](https://anilist.co/anime/100977) English dub (Mission: Health Comes First). She enjoys being active in many ways (weight lifting, hiking, surfing, sports) and loves going on adventures! She’s also a huge foodie and could talk to you for hours about how to perfectly construct a gourmet donut!

Fun fact: she has sung and appeared in a music video for a single released by J-Pop singer [Yun*Chi](https://anilist.co/staff/155885). She is also a part of the virtual idol group Interlunium, an 11 member group that releases original music and story. She even designed her own character, Akira!

(Source: Official Website)
